speaker: Dungeon Master & NPCs
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Magnus Burnsides
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Merle Highchurch
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Taako Taaco
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Episode 12 - Murder on the Rockport Limited - Chapter Three
Griffin
lines: Previously, on the Adventure Zone

speaker: Director
lines: Secure passage on this train. One of you will need to be Leeman Kessler. You will need to retrieve the relic, and get it back to us any way that you can.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is Tom Bodett anywhere in this town?

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] Is Tom Bodett literally—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Has anyone left a light on for us?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You manage to make it to the ticket counter.

speaker: Merle
lines: I’m Leeman Kessler.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I’m- I’m Diddley Kessler.

speaker: Tom Bodett
lines: You’re Diddley, that’s what I thought. And you, wizardly looking fellow?

speaker: Taako
lines: Justin.

speaker: Taako
lines: I cast Charm Person on Tom Bodett.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay.

speaker: Merle
lines: We want you to step in front of the next train that is coming by, okay?

speaker: Travis
lines: No!

speaker: Merle
lines: Is that okay?

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] Oh my god!

speaker: Merle
lines: If you don’t mind doing that for us.

speaker: Tom Bodett
lines: You need me to step—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, you hear from outside the train, “All aboard!” and Tom Bodett goes”

speaker: Tom Bodett
lines: Well, [laughter] time to— Time to go, I guess.

speaker: Announcer
lines: Come on, ride the train. It’s the Choo Choo and ride it! … [chuckling] It’s the Adventure Zone!

speaker: [THEME MUSIC
lines: "Déjà Vu" by Mort Garson (full song on YouTube)]

speaker: Griffin
lines: So the three of you have just checked in with Tom Bodett—one of the Tom Bodetts, one of the many, many animatronic Tom Bodetts that occupy Rockport—uh, and have boarded the train. Um, you walk in through a door to the main passenger car compartment—

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffy, is this, uh, is this train luxurious, or is it, like, utilitarian?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It is fully luxuried out. It is the Lexus of fantasy trains. I’m talking—

speaker: Justin
lines: [quietly] Thank goodness.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m talking gilded. It’s gilded with gold. It’s, uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: Gilded with gold, you say?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s uh—

speaker: Justin
lines: Fine thing to gild with.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s gilded with uh, silver and platinum—

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] Just gold. No—

speaker: Griffin
lines: No.

speaker: Clint
lines: No.

speaker: Justin
lines: Gold’s the only thing you can gild with.

speaker: Travis
lines: Can’t gild with anything else!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Watch me! [laughter] Watch me. It’s- it’s bedazzled with electrum— It’s a- it’s a— yeah, it’s a really nice train. Um—

speaker: Justin
lines: Smell good?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Smells great. Posh interior, soft seats, uh, shag carpeting, which is weird, but it’s like nice shag carpeting.

speaker: Justin
lines: Right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, so you walk in through the main passenger entrance, into the passenger car, and there waiting for you is a very tall, very finely dressed elven man, who is wearing a Rockport Limited uniform. Uh, he has a mustache which is rare for elves, not typically known for their, uh, bodacious facial hair, but there you are. And this man looks down at you as you are boarding the train, and says

speaker: Elven Man
lines: [slightly deep, flat voice] Tickets and weapons, please.

speaker: Merle
lines: Ah.

speaker: Taako
lines: No problem. Um, is it okay if I keep my umbrella in case of a storm?

speaker: Elven Man
lines: Well, yeah, it’s not—yeah, I wouldn’t typically consider that to be a weapon. Can I see your tickets please, though?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yes.

speaker: Taako
lines: Here you go.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yes! Here’s mine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He snatches them all up.

speaker: Justin
lines: Griffin, do we have tickets? Oh, we did get tickets.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Whoo, that was close! I almost had to kill him!

speaker: Griffin
lines: [chuckles] He snatches them up.

speaker: Elven Man
lines: Oh, Leeman Kessler! Oh yes, I understand we are carrying a, uh, very precious piece of cargo for you in the caboose.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] Yes, take good care of his package. [giggling]

speaker: Merle
lines: Ha ha!

speaker: Elven Man
lines: Terrific. This is kind of a fancy train, so if we could—

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Elven Man
lines: —maybe watch that stuff. Uh, my name is— [out of character] wait for it—

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughs] Tom Bodett.

speaker: Elven Man
lines: My name is—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] My name is Lazy DM.

speaker: Justin
lines: Did you know that there’s only one real Tom Bodett, and the rest are Tom Faux-detts? [laughter] It’s true.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Uh. My name is Hudson. I am the engineer of this train. Uh, welcome aboard. We’re- we’re happy to have you. We know that you have lots of choices to pick from for subterranean inter-city travel here, but uh— and we sure do appreciate the fact that you picked us!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, we tried to get on the Rockport Unlimited, but it was full.

speaker: Hudson
lines: [amused] That train is a little too extreme for most people. [Travis laughs] It doesn’t even go on rails. It just sort of— they j- they just sort of off-road it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] Well, where doesn’t it go?

speaker: Hudson
lines: Uh, well, it doesn’t get to its destination usually. It usually crashes and it’s pretty terrible. Uh, but thank you for- for uh, joining us. Uh, who are your compatriots here?

speaker: Merle
lines: [attempting a Scottish accent] Uh, my compatriots?

speaker: Hudson
lines: Oh, my god.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh no.

speaker: Merle
lines: Aye, Leeman has a Scottish accent!

speaker: Travis
lines: No, he doesn’t!

speaker: Hudson
lines: Okay…

speaker: Clint
lines: Yes, he does!

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, let me check my notes here he does not!

speaker: Clint
lines: [still talking in the bad accent] No, it’s right here in my character sheet!

speaker: Hudson
lines: That’s interesting, because the Leeman I spoke to—

speaker: Justin
lines: I keep turning down his volume, and it keep— I swear to god, it keeps getting louder.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think Dad has hacked into your mainframe. [Clint chuckles]

speaker: Travis
lines: He’s become self-aware!

speaker: Hudson
lines: You all are in luck. This is uh, this is actually not a very full train. You’ll have your pick of seating in the passenger car. You have your own room, uh—

speaker: Taako
lines: I didn’t introduce myself!

speaker: Hudson
lines: Oh, sorry, yes, go right ahead.

speaker: Taako
lines: I have a name as well!

speaker: Hudson
lines: Terrific!

speaker: Clint
lines: And feelings.

speaker: Taako
lines: [Awkwardly] Good day to you… Thank you for having me on your choo choo.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Are you disembarking? We haven’t even left the station yet.

speaker: Taako
lines: I need to find a seat that has a comfort… equitable… to my… situation!

speaker: Clint
lines: Big rump.

speaker: Hudson
lines: I appreciate your fancy speech. Um, that is- that is how we, uh—

speaker: Taako
lines: Gratuities to you…

speaker: Hudson
lines: Uh—

speaker: Taako
lines: …for the compliment.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Uh, now I will be in here—

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he points to the uh, the engine car to, uh, to his right at the head of the train. The engine car— the entrance to the car is a very high-security heavy metal door with a, like, window slot in it for him to look out. But it is— it’s a very secure door, and he says

speaker: Hudson
lines: I will- I will be in here for the duration of the trip. Uh, I-I- I won’t be coming out as just a security measure. Uh, if somebody were to take the helm of this train, they could— I mean, they could drive it—

speaker: Travis
lines: Is this, possibly, foreshadowing?

speaker: Clint
lines: Or rampant paranoia?

speaker: Travis
lines: [gruffly] I’m tellin’ you guys. Trust me. Oh, it could happen!

speaker: Hudson
lines: The, uh, Mountain Train Security Agency protocols demand that I stay in the engine for the duration of the trip, uh, with no visitors. I’m sure some of you would like to learn how a choo choo works—

speaker: Magnus
lines: I’d like to sit on your lap.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Well, and I—

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] Maybe steer a little bit.

speaker: Hudson
lines: You are not alone in that desire, but unfortunately, it’s, uh, engineers only in the engine. Uh, and after the trip, I will escort you to the crypt safe in the caboose, and I will help you retrieve your, uh, your package. Uh, but from that point on, it’s- it’s in your hands.

speaker: Taako
lines: [giggles] Sorry, uh, just to clarify, where was the package again?

speaker: Hudson
lines: The package is in the caboose, I don’t—

speaker: Merle
lines: [laughing] “The package is in the caboose!” Ahahaha oh… Oh…

speaker: Magnus
lines: Thank you very much, we’ll be retiring to our rooms now.

speaker: Hudson
lines: [amused] Okay, well. This was a great talk, and [Travis and Clint laugh] I feel like if other people were listening to this conversation — say, thousands and thousands of people — they would put their, uh, listening apparatus down, and they would go, “Wow, that was a good recorded conversation I just listened to.”

speaker: Clint
lines: And then puncture their own ear drums.

speaker: Hudson
lines: And if, say, those listeners had, uh, somehow paid money to support our conversation, [Clint laughs] they would say, “Yes, I have chosen to spend my money wisely, and I feel great about my life and my decisions.” Um, but see you later! Smell you later!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Hudson
lines: Yeah, before you go, I just need to, uh, grab your weapons from you. Uh, these will also be locked up in the, uh, vault, and we’ll be returning them to you as soon as we reach our final destination.

speaker: Magnus
lines: But my whole body is a weapon. You see, [Justin laughs] I’ve trained myself—

speaker: Hudson
lines: Listen—

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] Thank you, Barney Fife.

speaker: Hudson
lines: You’re— Are you one of those magic flesh swords? [Travis laughs]

speaker: Magnus
lines: I am.

speaker: Hudson
lines: I’ve heard about those, where a- a, uh, a young witch kisses a sword, and it turns into a human man.

speaker: Magnus
lines: It was something like that.

speaker: Hudson
lines: [amused] I read about that in my Penthouse magazine.

speaker: Travis
lines: “I never believed it would happen to me.”

speaker: Hudson
lines: Uh, no I just— just give me those weapons, and I’ll lock ‘em right up. Put ‘em right in the car. You’ll never know that they were missing. Unless you need them. But you won’t, super safe train.

speaker: Clint
lines: Hmm.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I do hold on to my glove, though.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Which one?

speaker: Magnus
lines: My gauntlet.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Yeah, that’s fine. What could you possibly do with a gauntlet?

speaker: Magnus
lines: [sheepishly] Well it keeps in— I have Smelly Hand Syndrome.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Oh my god, me too. I didn’t think I’d ever meet another.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He pulls off uh, the uh, leather glove that he has over his left hand,  and—

speaker: Taako
lines: [crosstalk] Oh god! Ooh!

speaker: Griffin
lines: —it stinks. [Clint makes a disgusted sound] There’s a stink to it that, uh, it almo- almost seems supernatural, almost as if he’s been cursed, uh, on his hand.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I mean, that’s pretty bad, I guess.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Can I, let me try— Can I have a whiff of your brand?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Unfortunately, no. Um, there was a law passed that I was not allowed to remove my gauntlet.

speaker: Hudson
lines: [crosstalk] I just made— I made myself very vulnerable just then. [Justin laughs]

speaker: Taako
lines: [amused] Let the man smell your hand!

speaker: Merle
lines: [crosstalk] Smell his hand. Give him your hand.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I, um, I can’t do that. I’m not at that point in my therapy yet.

speaker: Hudson
lines: [annoyed] Well, god, fine!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says, and, uh, takes up your weapons. Are you handing your weapons to him or not?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Uh.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, I’ll give him Smasher and Little Choppy.

speaker: Justin
lines: And I cast, just as he’s leaving, I cast, uh, Prestidigitation on Travis’s hands to give them a terrible odor.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Hudson
lines: [startled] Oh my god!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Wh— How did that— Can you control your hand stink? It’s almost as if you’ve just emitted a cloud—

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] There’s a valve on the glove.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Oh, terrific! Is that like a— ooh, is that like a crime-fighting tool?

speaker: Magnus
lines: No.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Like- like stinky hand knock-out gas, and you shoot it out of your finger.

speaker: Magnus
lines: It’s more just, like, a relationship-ender.

speaker: Hudson
lines: Oh. Well, not for me, man.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Wait, wait, did you find women who were into this? Is there a chatroom I can join?

speaker: Hudson
lines: No, I’m just saying I’m feeling— I’m feeling you. As a buddy. As a friend. Anyway, your weapons will be waiting for you when you, uh, when we reach Neverwinter. Until then, maybe keep the valve closed ‘cause not everyone’s gonna— not everyone likes getting high on your own supply.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, and he walks into the engine compartment, and the door slams closed, and you hear a heavy clunk! And, uh, yeah. That’s it for the engineer character. What did you guys think of him? [laughter] Scale of- scale of one to ten.

speaker: Clint
lines: I liked— I thought he had good motivation, I thought, uh, his character development was good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, walking through the passenger car, you only see three other passengers on this ride. And they’re not sitting together, they don’t seem to know each other, they’re not conversing, they’re all just sort of doing their own little things. Uh, one of them is a stout, dwarven woman, uh, with the largest muscles you’ve ever seen on a living person. Um, she looks kind of—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Wait, hold on! Magnus is in the room.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, yeah. Deal with it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh. Oh no.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, she looks— She’s kind of fidgeting, looking out the window. She just kind of looks a little bit uncomfortable. Um, sitting about two rows behind her and on the other side of the car is a young boy, who is wearing a fancy-boy suit—

speaker: Travis
lines: Mhm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —and a fa- a blue fancy boy cap. Uh, dressed up very fanci-fancily.

speaker: Travis
lines: Can I roll, um, insight to see how fancy?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, sure, if you want.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, that’s a 17. Oh, sorry, yes. Uhh—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh my god, yeah. Make sure to really add this up—

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh it’s a 16, it’s a minus one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, a minus one. Then you die. [laughter] God, Travis, if only you— in trying to discern his fanciness, your nose just starts bleeding, and you fall over and—

speaker: Clint
lines: You’re fancied to death.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, yeah no, he’s fresh to death. He- he looks- he looks very fancy. Um, like a schoolboy, but fancy. And he’s reading a book like a schoolboy would do, and he’s a fancy young man. And then, sitting a couple rows behind him is a, uh, round young human man with a great big bushy beard.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] A great big bushy beard!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And uh, he’s wearing some sort of trashy wizard’s robes. They’re not as, uh—

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] You mean like bad, or you mean like trashy sexy? [laughs] Some mesh in the sleeves—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] It’s both, actually. It’s—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] You can see the electric tape over his nipples.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] No, it’s— I mean it’s— [Clint laughs] it covers all his essential, uh, oils, but he— It does say “Juicy” on the back of the robe, [laughter] where his butt would be. Um—

speaker: Travis
lines: Are we on a train to Jersey?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes. Neverwinter is in New Jersey. Not a lot of people, um, know that. This is, like, an alt-America sort of like Dark Tower, um, I should’ve pointed out, so, um. No, that’s not true. Please don’t buy into that at all. Uh, yeah, that is the passenger car as you continue walking back to, you know, set down your personal effects in your sleeper car.

speaker: Griffin
lines: As you- as you pass through the chamber connecting the two, uh, cars, you open up the door to the sleeper car, and another elf is there. Another fairly tall elven man is there, wearing the garb, wearing the uniform for the Rockport Limited. Um, he is also wearing a sort of technicolor bowtie that’s prismatic and- and shifting in hues. Um, and he looks down at you, and he comes up with a voice for himself very quickly.

speaker: Elven Man
lines: [in a low, thick voice] Hello. Oh, new passengers. I… haven’t met you. Welcome—

speaker: Griffin
lines: What is this?

speaker: Travis
lines: [mimicking the voice] “I instantly regret this voice.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: [working on the voice] “Mm hello, welcome.” There it is.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] He sounds like Mike Myers.

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] Sounds like Vincent Price.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I found it.

speaker: Elven Man
lines: Hello, welcome to the train.

speaker: Justin
lines: “I’m Mike Myers as Lorne Michaels having a stroke.”

speaker: Elven Man
lines: [slow and deadpan] I’m doing my best. Welcome to— [Justin mocks his voice] Are you making fun of my voice?

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] He’s melting!

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] He’s getting sadder in front of our eyes!

speaker: Justin
lines: Who dumped a bucket of water on this guy?

speaker: Elven Man
lines: How could I be sad? I’ve got new passengers— [someone mocks his voice again] Goddammit, can I talk? [laughter] Welcome to the train. My name’s Jenkins. Can I help you find your seats, or your, where to put your luggage, man, I don’t know.

speaker: Taako
lines: I like your tie, Jenkins. Tell me about it.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: This is my- my flair. We all get to wear one piece of flair on Tuesdays.

speaker: Magnus
lines: What does it do?

speaker: Taako
lines: What’s it do? What’s its thing?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Tell me all about it, stud!

speaker: Jenkins
lines: [amused] It looks amazing.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, yes!

speaker: Jenkins
lines: It doesn’t possess any curative properties, or, what— Who are you?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Does it spin?

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Stop, stop.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I wanna unfold this bowtie thing.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Wait, stop. Let’s start over. Hello, I’m Jenkins. [laughter] I’m the wizard attendant on the Rockport Limited. I will, uh, help you with your bags—

speaker: Travis
lines: I reach out slowly to touch his bowtie.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: [awkwardly] Oh-kay, you can… touch it, I guess. [laughter] Light surface—

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] You can— You can keep going.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Um, a light surface level touch would be preferred. [laughter]

speaker: Travis
lines: I really g- I really get in there.

speaker: Merle
lines: Are you an attendant who’s a wizard, or are you an attendant for a wizard?

speaker: Jenkins
lines: I am a wizard who attends to your needs on the train. You let me know if you have any questions. I can take your bags, and I have a few other luxury services I can provide.

speaker: Griffin
lines: My thr— voice is, like, shot from this weekend, and it’s really—I, like— we have to record all of—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] No one made you do this voice, Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This needs to— I’m just saying, we need to do a series wrap on Jenkins in this episode, [laughter] ‘cause I don’t think I’m gonna be able to do him next week. Um—

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughing] I kill Jenkins! [laughter]

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Thank you; you’ve set— [Travis laughs] Uh, I have a few luxury services I can provide to you. I can take you into one of our pleasure rooms.

speaker: Taako
lines: [awkwardly] I’m cool.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [laughs] No thank you!

speaker: Jenkins
lines: It’s not—

speaker: Merle
lines: [crosstalk] Nope! Pass.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Oh, gentlemen, it’s not nearly as salacious as I made it sound. It’s just when I say things with my voice, it always sounds like I’m talking about slow sex. [laughter]

speaker: Magnus
lines: Jenkins, I’ve just noticed, I think your bowtie is too tight!

speaker: Travis
lines: I loosen it slightly.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Does that help?

speaker: Jenkins
lines: [in Griffin’s normal voice] Oh my god, thank you, guys! [laughter and clapping] A witch kissed me, and it cursed my [more laughter] [back to Jenkins’ voice] No, that’s a joke, this is—

speaker: Clint
lines: Can we level up for that? That was great.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: I feel very comfortable with this voice now, yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: Now it’s like an old pair of shoes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, he helps you all unload your luggage into your sleeper car. Uh, there’s uh, there’s a triple bunk bed. [laughs] It’s basically like a big ol’ neapolitan ice cream sandwich of dudes, [laughter] and you feel like the smell in there is gonna get pretty ripe pretty fast. It’s not a very big car, um, but he helps you load up, and uh, starts to show you around the train. Uh, so he says,

speaker: Jenkins
lines: This is the sleeper car. Well, hold on. Sorry, I hit my R very hard there. [Travis laughs] So, uh, this of course is the sleeper car. You will, uh, you can rest in here. The trip will take about three hours once the train departs, which it should any minute, so you won’t need a full night’s sleep. But if you’re feeling nappy, this is a place where, historically, people sleep.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Jenkins, can I ask you a question?

speaker: Jenkins
lines: I’m not finished.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: What you’re going to want to do is place the pillow underneath your head.

speaker: Taako
lines: We know how to go to sleep, darling!

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Just checking. I- I’m here to serve, to attend to your every need. So, you’re all set on blankets.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah—

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] We actually need extra pillows. I sleep with a pillow between my knees and between my elbows and behind my  head and under my feet, if I could get—

speaker: Griffin
lines: So we’re- we’re gonna do this now, huh? [Travis laughs] We’re gonna air this right now?

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] I prescribe to the Griffin McElroy sleeping method.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I need to build myself a fucking exosuit of pillows, [laughter] and I’m not, like, I’m not, like, proud of it. Like, yeah, I am embarrassed about it, and it makes trips with my family a living hell.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughs] A pillowy hell!

speaker: Justin
lines: You go into a room you’re sharing with Griffin, then you look for a pillow, there’s just none there. He’s absorbed them all.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. I need them for strength and energy. Uh, Jenkins says, uh

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Now, of course, the car that you passed through coming in was the passenger car, and that is a car that is great for sitting.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Now, Jenkins, I saw a—

speaker: Merle
lines: [crosstalk] Thank you, Captain Obvious.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I saw a dwarven woman in there, and I swear I recognized her, and I can’t remember her name, and I don’t want that awkward moment, you know what I mean? Do you have any information on her?

speaker: Jenkins
lines: I’m not supposed to share privileged information—

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] Come on, Jenkins…

speaker: Jenkins
lines: —regarding the identity of—

speaker: Merle
lines: [whispering] Give him some- Give him a bribe! Give him some money!

speaker: Jenkins
lines: [crosstalk] We run a very discreet travel service, um…

speaker: Magnus
lines: Jenkins…

speaker: Jenkins
lines: …for…

speaker: Merle
lines: Jenkins!

speaker: Magnus & Merle
lines: Come on!

speaker: Merle
lines: Jenkins…

speaker: Taako
lines: Remember the thing with the tie?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Remember…?

speaker: Jenkins
lines: When you touched my tie despite my request that you did not, and—

speaker: Taako
lines: [crosstalk] No, we freed you—

speaker: Merle
lines: [crosstalk] And it helped you out and felt good.

speaker: Jenkins

lines: He’s the bad guy [Angus crosstalking trying to say “excuse me”] [whispering] We’ve, that’s definitely the bad guy, that’s definitely the bad guy!

speaker: Angus
lines: Excuse me, sirs. My grandpa says it’s rude to whisper, especially on a train. My name’s Angus!

speaker: Magnus
lines: We had to say dirty words, Angus, dirty words that you can’t hear. Adult words.

speaker: Merle
lines: [crosstalk] Hi Angus!

speaker: Angus
lines: My grandpa s- my grandpa says swears are not—

speaker: Taako
lines: Hi Angus, where are you from?

speaker: Angus
lines: Me? I’m not allowed to say.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Are you from Phandalin?

speaker: Angus
lines: No, where is that?

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] Good. Doesn’t matter.

speaker: Angus
lines: I’ve never even heard of Phandalin.

speaker: Magnus
lines: And you never will.

speaker: Taako
lines: And you never will.

speaker: Angus
lines: I like to read my books because it- it’s like I get to go on a journey in my mind!

speaker: Magnus
lines: [whispering] Taako! It’s definitely-

speaker: Angus
lines: What are your names?

speaker: Magnus
lines: [whispering] What little kid likes reading? It’s him!

speaker: Angus
lines: Sirs, what are your names?

speaker: Merle
lines: Well, um, like I said-

speaker: Angus
lines: I already heard your name, sir. Thank you for telling me it.

speaker: Merle
lines: [crosstalk] Oh, right, sorry.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I’m-I’m Diddley.

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m Justin.

speaker: Angus
lines: Diddley and Justin, those are two fabulous names. My name’s Angus!

speaker: Magnus
lines: What’s your last name, Angus?

speaker: Angus
lines: McDonald.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [chuckles] Angus McDonald, you say?

speaker: Merle
lines: Angus, do you like magic tricks?

speaker: Angus
lines: I do. I like them very much, my grandpa said he would take me to one in Neverwinter. He would take me- He told me—

speaker: Magnus
lines: What’s your grandpa’s name?

speaker: Angus
lines: My grandpa told me, he said, “I’m going to take you to a magic trick!” It didn’t make a lot of sense-

speaker: Magnus
lines: Angus, are you off-put by three grown men standing over you, asking you a bunch of questions?

speaker: Angus
lines: No, I was hoping I would meet people and make friends on the train.

speaker: Merle
lines: Even though you’re not allowed to talk to ‘em? That’s pretty interesting!

speaker: Angus
lines: Well, strangers aren’t strangers anymore once you’ve talked to them and learned their names.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Do you want to go to the pleasure room with me?

speaker: Angus
lines: I already went to the pleasure room. I went to my dad’s library. Did I say my dad? I meant my grandpa.

speaker: Magnus
lines: What’s your grandpa’s name?

speaker: Angus
lines: My grandpa forgot his name. He’s very old.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Wait, but you also forgot it? You never knew it, Angus?

speaker: Angus
lines: The memory of my grandpa’s name died long before I was born.

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughs] It’s a word not spoken since the birth of dragons.

speaker: Angus
lines: He prefers- He prefers grandpa. I call him grandpa, ‘cause he’s my grandpa! I love him.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [whispering] This is definitely a setup. He’s the bad guy!

speaker: Merle
lines: Well let me show him my magic trick.

speaker: Justin
lines: [still laughing] Just let it ride.

speaker: Merle
lines: Let me show you this magic trick, alright?

speaker: Angus
lines: Ok, sir.

speaker: Merle
lines: It- it’s called Zone of Truth. And when I cast Zone of Truth, well, you’ll just have to see how cool it is.

speaker: Magnus
lines: No wait!

speaker: Clint
lines: Merle casts Zone of Truth.

speaker: Angus
lines: My- my brain feels like it's tingling. I feel like I’m sneezing, but long. Like a long sneeze.

speaker: Merle
lines: That’s the magic!

speaker: Angus
lines: Is it- uh- it’s not a- I uh- ok!

speaker: Merle
lines: Great!

speaker: Angus
lines: I get a chance to roll and resist this, right?

speaker: Merle
lines: Yes you do, you get to throw a charisma saving roll.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ok.

speaker: Travis
lines: And- and Clinton, remind me, does this affect all of us in the zone?

speaker: Clint
lines: No it’s just whoever I target it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh thank Jesus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t think that’s true.

speaker: Justin
lines: I don’t actually think that’s accurate either.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think the Zone of Truth is a zone. Otherwise it would just be called Truth Beam- and you would hit it-

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, he rolled a 24.

speaker: Clint and Justin
lines: What?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he-

speaker: Travis
lines: No that’s too low, we were looking for a 25.

speaker: Angus
lines: Hey, the tingles went away! That was a weird trick.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, you’re growing up!

speaker: Justin
lines: Can I- can I have a little side chat? If this fool just rolled a 24, he is uhh a really fucking bad guy. That’s like some mysterious shit.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk whispering] He’s the bad guy!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s racist!

speaker: Travis
lines: You can’t hear this, we’re whispering!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right.

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] Nah, he- he heard us!

speaker: Justin
lines: This is clearly out of character!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, and this is out of character too. I’m telling you you’re being racist right now. Just because someone rolls good, that makes them evil? It’s- it’s a luck-based—

speaker: Travis
lines: Rolling good is a race, Griffin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s a luck-based mechanism—

speaker: Travis
lines: I’ve seen the dice!

speaker: Clint
lines: How can y- how can you roll a 20-sided dice and get a 24?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He had a lotta charisma. He’s a charismatic young man.

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughing] He’s- he’s in the Boy Scouts of America, he volunteers at his local soup kitchen, he’s a great kid. [whispering] He’s definitely the bad guy!

speaker: Clint
lines: Magnus, kill him.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well—

speaker: Clint
lines: Kill him.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hold on, he’s still a kid.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Well don’t— he’s a little boy.

speaker: Justin
lines: We’re not going to kill a little boy.

speaker: Angus
lines: Pardon me, sirs, do you have any fruit leather? I ran- I just plum ran out.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Alright, Angus. We’re going to go talk to Juicy Wizard.

speaker: Angus
lines: Uh. Okay. I had a good chat with you and I liked—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, we’re done.

speaker: Angus
lines: Okay, sirs, well thank you very much for take—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Angus! Take the hint.

speaker: Angus
lines: ‘Kay, bye, just thanks for the company. Bye!

speaker: Griffin
lines: As you turn to walk away from him, you swear that you see the color of his eyes just turn blood red, [laughter] and- No, I’m fucking with you. That’s not true. Umm, you’re going to talk to Juicy Wizard?

speaker: Travis
lines: Mhm.

speaker: Justin
lines: [quietly] No-

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ok, Juicy- Juicy Wizard is uh, sort of, uh, running his hands over the pleasure room chamber, like, just sort of eyeballing it. Like, studying it almost? And he’s like-

speaker: Juicy Wizard
lines: [higher voice] Wow, this thing’s amazing. Don’t you guys love being on this train? This train’s the best!

speaker: Magnus
lines: It’s pretty dope!

speaker: Juicy Wizard
lines: Sorry, what are your names? I feel rude ‘cause I talked about how much I love this train before I introduced myself. And before you had a chance to introduce yourselves.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh, uh, my name is Diddley.

speaker: Juicy Wizard
lines: Diddley?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Mhmm, Did- Diddley.

speaker: Juicy Wizard
lines: Is that short for something?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Bo-Diddley.

speaker: Juicy Wizard
lines: Wouldn’t it- wouldn’t Bo be a much easier way to truncate that particular moniker?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Way less fun, am I right, my man?

speaker: Juicy Wizard
lines: You are so right! My name is—

speaker: Magnus
lines: High five!

speaker: Juicy Wizard
lines: Okay, let’s get that out there. Now I can tell you that my name is Graham. It’s not as fun. I still sound like the boy that you were just talking to-

speaker: Magnus
lines: You have a youthful energy about you!

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah. A very Angus-like vibe.

speaker: Graham
lines: Uh, what are your guys’s names?

speaker: Merle
lines: I’m Leeman. Leeman Kessler.

speaker: Graham
lines: Hi, Leeman!

speaker: Merle
lines: Hi, Graham.

speaker: Taako
lines: Justin.

speaker: Graham
lines: Uh, I can’t help but notice your garb. Your robe and your hat. Are you perchance a wizard too?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, man.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] [laughs] Totally!

speaker: Taako
lines: Don’t you recognize me from TV?

speaker: Graham
lines: Oh my god, is it really you?

speaker: Taako
lines: Justin… is a stage name. No, wait. Strike that. Taako— How old are you, Graham?

speaker: Graham
lines: Me?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yep.

speaker: Graham
lines: Oh, I’m— I’m, uh— Me? Oh, my age?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yep.

speaker: Graham
lines: Me? My age?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m trying to—

speaker: Graham
lines: [voice getting deeper] Me? My age? I’m an— I’m not a little boy, I’m—

speaker: Travis
lines: He’s aging before our very eyes!

speaker: Taako
lines: Okay, pipe down, Benjamin—

speaker: Graham
lines: [crosstalk] I’m 36 years young!

speaker: Taako
lines: Pipe down, Benjamin Button, let me lay it down for you. Um, I’m Taako the wizard from TV, yes, it’s great to meet you too. Ah, but on the train, uhhh, when I’m in private life, I go by my real name, Justin Leeman.

speaker: Graham
lines: Oh, that’s not that weird to have a train name. [laughter] A name— A name that you use, only on trains. Can I tell you something?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah— [laughs]

speaker: Graham
lines: [voice slightly deeper] Can I tell you— Can I tell you something?

speaker: Taako
lines: Please.

speaker: Graham
lines: [voice getting even deeper] Can I tell you something?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, go— go nuts, my man.

speaker: Graham
lines: Graham is my train name.

speaker: Taako
lines: Do you have another real name?

speaker: Graham
lines: Yeah! Per—

speaker: Taako
lines: What is it?

speaker: Graham
lines: Percy.

speaker: Merle
lines: Good choice with Graham.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, Graham is way better.

speaker: Graham
lines: It just feels like a thing that you would say on a train!

speaker: Taako
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, absolutely— it does. It feels like a train name, I was thinking that.

speaker: Merle
lines: [crosstalk] Mhm.

speaker: Graham
lines: [crosstalk] Check this out “All aboard, Percy!” It just doesn’t work, does it? Anyway—

speaker: Taako
lines: [crosstalk] Doesn’t work.

speaker: Graham
lines: Graham’s— Graham’s my name.

speaker: Taako
lines: Graham, what’s your school of magic, my man?

speaker: Graham
lines: Uh, I’m undeclared. Working on it! It’s just—

speaker: Taako
lines: [crosstalk] Oh, that’s fine. I remember that age.

speaker: Graham
lines: [crosstalk] I move down one ladder, and it’s like—

speaker: Taako
lines: [crosstalk] Sure.

speaker: Graham
lines: [crosstalk] —Yeah, I— evocation’s pretty great, but I’d sure love to turn that apple into, uh, something else! See, I lack creativity, and that help— that hinders me.

speaker: Taako
lines: That’s a hindrance, right, but you’ll find it. Don’t beat yourself up.

speaker: Graham
lines: Will I?

speaker: Taako
lines: Mm…

speaker: Clint
lines: Hm.

speaker: Travis
lines: He is 36.

speaker: Graham
lines: What I really wanna do,

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says, is, uh

speaker: Graham
lines: is I, uh, I would love to work on a train. It’s been my dream my whole life, is to be, be a work on a train, be whatever role they need me on, just to live life on the rails. It’s just someth— It’s just always appeal— This train is amazing! They have a pleasure chamber—

speaker: Taako
lines: [crosstalk] Grab— Just grab a mop, my man! Grab life by the horns.

speaker: Graham
lines: What do you— Just, like, start mopping? And just, like, see—

speaker: Taako
lines: Just start mopping, yeah!

speaker: Graham
lines: And see what happens?

speaker: Taako
lines: Sure!

speaker: Graham
lines: Is that the Secret?

speaker: Merle
lines: Either that, or be a hobo.

speaker: Taako
lines: YOLO.

speaker: Graham
lines: I could be a yobo.

speaker: Taako
lines: A YOLO hobo.

speaker: Graham
lines: I would have a hard time finding a place where I could squat on- on this particular train. But, uh—

speaker: Magnus
lines: No, just go in the bathroom!

speaker: Graham
lines: Gross. [Clint and Travis laugh] What a very gross thing. Yeah, I’ve— I actually— it’s uncomfortable because, um, I just applied to be on this train, and I didn’t get accepted. Um, and so I just sort of came on to shadow, uh, Jenkins, just to, like, see what I could learn. See what I could pick up—

speaker: Travis
lines: I lean over to Taako.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [whispering] Motive! That’s motive!

speaker: Taako
lines: You’re a— You’re a worse wizard than Jenkins?

speaker: Justin
lines: I said that loud enough so that Jenkins could hear.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Why would you do that?

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, I didn’t want you to have to waste a spell slot trying to read my mind.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, he says—

speaker: Taako
lines: I know how precious they are.

speaker: Graham
lines: I feel like this conversation is starting to take a turn for the worse, so I’m gonna head out. Not leave, ‘cause the train’s going through a mountain, and I would die, [Clint and Justin laugh] but, you get the picture.

speaker: Taako
lines: Sure, yeah.

speaker: Graham
lines: It was great to meet you guys!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, and he walks [amused] just not very far away from you. Uh, he- he walks, uh, like eight feet away from you and sits down at a table by himself. It was very clear he didn’t have any pressing, like, engagement that he needed to get to. He just— I think he preferred not your company at that point.

speaker: Clint
lines: We are really making friends on this train.

speaker: Justin
lines: Influencing people.

speaker: [the music plays, a final message from Griffin about their sponsors, and the episode ends]
